intro: Ervatamia pubescens var. barbatocalyx, commonly known as the barbatocalyx ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
